intro: Telanthophora cobanensis, commonly known as the Coban mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with five petals that are often spotted or streaked. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Telanthophora cobanensis is considered a rare and endemic species.
